technology.name: State Troop Standards
technology.description: As regiments gain renown, their standards become talismans that are just as important as their sword-arms.

technology.name: State-Issued Infantry Armour
technology.description: State Troops are often issued with armour plate to ensure unit cohesion and a reasonable level of protection.

technology.name: Improved Cavalry Armour
technology.description: Thicker plates for riders and scaled barding for their mounts, meaning a greater percentage survive to charge again.

technology.name: Endurance Training
technology.description: Riding for days whilst bearing full kit increases one's stamina for the real thing.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction for cavalry units

technology.name: Firing Drills
technology.description: Packing a wallop when they strike, artillery crews are also measured on their firing rates; the faster the better.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +8% for artillery units

technology.name: Multiple Artillery Barrels
technology.description: More barrels, more chances to knock enemy blocks clean off – it's simply a matter of arithmetic.

technology.name: Mass-Produced Small Ammunition
technology.description: Industrialised production of ammunition for handguns has allowed the Empire to hoard large supplies.

effects.description: Ammunition: +10% for Free Company Militia, Crossbowmen, Huntsmen, Archers, Handgunners, Pistoliers and Outriders missile units

technology.name: Mounted Weaponry
technology.description: Fixing arms atop mounts and rides does away with the need to dismount and set up prior to firing, in turn reducing vulnerability and increasing efficiency.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 5% for Pistoliers and Outriders units
Missile strength: +10% for Pistoliers and Outriders units

technology.name: Improved Heavy Weapons
technology.description: Refined ore techniques create stronger steel, making for more durable blades and heavier weapon-heads.

effects.description: Attribute: Expert Charge Defence for Halberdier units

technology.name: State-Issued Weapons
technology.description: Although the cost falls to each individual soldier, it is expected that all will use standardised equipment.

effects.description: Melee defence: +4 for melee infantry units
Charge bonus: +8% for melee infantry units

technology.name: Blinkers
technology.description: What a mount cannot see will not spook them, ensuring every charge hits the target squarely.

technology.name: The Inner Circle
technology.description: The Knights of the Inner Circle are the elite of the elite, amongst the best fighting men of the Empire.

technology.name: Ordnance Canisters
technology.description: When the enemy might be an enormous monster taller than the highest spire, it's a good idea not to run out of ammo!

technology.name: Reinforced Armour Plating
technology.description: Even the largest hulking war machine can be made more resilient to attack.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 8% for Steam Tank and War Wagon units

technology.name: Volley Fire
technology.description: Missile units who train together excel at firing a deadly hail, so not all members of a regiment have to see the target.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +15% for Free Company Militia, Crossbowmen, Huntsmen, Archers, Handgunners, Pistoliers and Outriders units

technology.name: Rifled Barrels
technology.description: The discovery of barrel-rifling led to increases in speed and accuracy. Both Dwarfs and men claim credit for this invention.

effects.description: Missile strength: +10% for Free Company Militia, Crossbowmen, Huntsmen, Archers and Handgunners units

technology.name: Commodity Trading
technology.description: There's always a new market to be tapped, or a fresh approach to existing ones.

technology.name: Warhorse Breeding
technology.description: Selective breeding allows the Empire to have good supply of steeds, capable of carrying heavily-armoured Knights into battle.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Empire Knights, Knights of the Blazing Sun, and Reiksguard units
Recruitment cost: -15% for Empire Knights, Knights of the Blazing Sun, and Reiksguard units

technology.name: Supply Wagons
technology.description: An army can only march as far as its supplies will last. Wagons loaded with goods allow for larger forces.

technology.name: Engineers' Guild
technology.description: Being able to share acquired knowledge among your peers can only lead to better results all round.

technology.name: Continuous Production
technology.description: Interchangeable parts and constant work shifts ensure production targets are met or even exceeded.

technology.name: Guildmaster Professors
technology.description: The greatest minds of the Old World are gathered by the Empire’s various institutions to impart their knowledge and methods of efficiency.

effects.description: Income from Iron, Gem and Gold Mines: +15%

technology.name: Imperial Architects
technology.description: The Imperial Architects are an eccentric bunch who have always had, well, let's say 'fanciful' ideas about how a building should look…

technology.name: Tithe Rebates
technology.description: A rebate is a useful tool when things are good to ensure compliance during the hard times inevitably just around the corner.

technology.name: Grain Silos
technology.description: It's comforting for people to know where their next meal will come from when winter's chill descends.

technology.name: Colonial Factors
technology.description: This joint-stock enterprise, if the trade winds prevail, is bound to make both factors and shareholders filthy, stinking rich. Amen.

technology.name: Assembly Line
technology.description: This progressive assembly enables swifter production of all manner of industrial goods.

technology.name: Local Militia
technology.description: The bravest, most-accomplished warriors do not always come from among the nobility, but must get their start somewhere.

technology.name: Clergy of Sigmar
technology.description: One god, one way, many agents to guarantee compliance in defence of the faith.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +3 for Warrior Priests
Hero recruit rank: +3 for Witch Hunters

technology.name: Manorialism
technology.description: Lords rule and live well, peasants work themselves to death and must pay for the privilege – it's the perfect model for any truly forward-looking society.

effects.description:
[HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
	(all armies)

technology.name: Imperial University
technology.description: This colonial campus maintains the high standards taught within the Imperial Colleges of Magic back home.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +3 for Empire Captains
Hero recruit rank: +3 for Battle Wizards

technology.name: Combustion Agent
technology.description: "An eighth of an ounce of this, a pinch of that, and half a pound of the other and… Boom! We have ignition!"

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Volley Gun, Helstorm Rocket Battery, Luminark of Hysh, Steam Tank and War Wagon

technology.name: Improved Piston Technology
technology.description: A more efficient way of transferring force from gas under pressure speeds up the production process, meaning more steam-powered weapons ready for the fight.

effects.description: Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Steam Tank, War Wagon and Luminark of Hysh units

technology.name: Intelligence Sharing
technology.description: Intelligence shared is intelligence doubled.

technology.name: Emissary to the Prince of Altdorf
technology.description: This trusted advisor, whose loyalty is beyond reproach, knows the Emperor's mind almost as well as Karl Franz himself!

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +25 with Empire, Kislev and Southern Realms

technology.name: Ambassador to the Phoenix King
technology.description: Successful dealings with the lofty, aloof Asur takes a certain type of individual if awkward diplomatic misunderstandings are to be avoided.

technology.name: Ambassador to the Karaz Ankor
technology.description: Diplomatic and discreet, this one knows exactly how to deal with fiery Dwarfen temperaments, so is well placed to run the Imperial embassy to the Everlasting Realm.

technology.name: Ambassador to the Royarch of Bretonnia
technology.description: Deferent and respectful, the embassy to Bretonnia understands perfectly the customs and traditions of this ancient feudal society.

technology.name: Hunters' Guild
technology.description: Such groups are formed so that knowledge and experience can be shared for the betterment of all their members.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for all Imperial Supplies units

technology.name: Seaborne Logistics
technology.description: Fledgling colonists must be supplied from back home in the Old World until the Empire's mark is firmly made upon its new lands.

technology.name: Purge of the Foul
technology.description: Foul Greenskins, flea-infested Skaven, gluttonous Ogres and slimy Lizardmen are abroad in sufficient numbers that an organised cull is now necessary.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Ogres and Lizardmen
Melee defence: +5 when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Ogres and Lizardmen

technology.name: Purge of the Fell
technology.description: There may be fell Necromancy afoot, for the Undead and Unliving infest Imperial territory in too greater numbers, hastening the need for an immediate purge.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
Leadership: +5 when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings

technology.name: Purge of the Knife-Ears
technology.description: These lands belong to the Empire – those arrogant, knife-eared Elves must be driven back to their own dominion, and with haste!

effects.description: Missile resistance: 5% when fighting against Elves

technology.name: Purge of the Ruinous Breeds
technology.description: The taint of Chaos has been observed here; such things must not be allowed to gain a foothold and be removed without delay!

effects.description: Leadership: +5 when fighting against Norsca, Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos and Beastmen
Weapon strength: +5% for all units when fighting against Norsca, Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos and Beastmen

technology.name: Colonial Fort
technology.description: A vital foothold in new territory and a home-from-home for Imperial subjects abroad on colonial business.

technology.name: Imperial Reinforcements
technology.description: If you've got a problem and no one else can help… call the Empire's best to settle the issue once and for all!

effects.description: Receive an additional detachment of reinforcements with every Imperial Supplies delivery
